page.title: 01Village of Menheniot & Dist.
page.content: Most of the block is agricultural land. Several farms of small field systems provide grazing pasture for dairy and several flocks of sheep. Like most of south east Cornall the terrain is hilly in nature and well watered by streams and springs. The dominant residential area is the village of Menheniot. The population of this village has trebled in the last two decades, and it is mainly a dormitory for Plymouth and Liskeard. This is made convenient by the A38 trunk road and the Plymouth/Penzance main line railway passing through the block.
